projects.title: Reports Coordinator at N-Sea Data Centre
projects.description:
N-Sea’s Data Centre facility is based at the company’s head office in the Netherlands; its focus is to manage survey data & information and support all aspects of the company’s business lines using the latest technology. Support is provided for projects throughout their life cycle (initiation, planning, execution & completion).  In this way, the Data Centre is involved in aspects such as tendering, project planning & procedure review, real-time technical support to field teams, in-house data processing & reporting, through to final deliverables and project completion.

By the varied nature of the work undertaken by N-Sea & the Data Centre, delivery requirements and processing turnaround times will vary for each project. N-Sea utilize experienced and committed professionals to process and manage data, to meet client requirements for data delivery, both in quality & timing.

projects.title: Party Chief Belwind retrofit continuity clamps installation project
projects.description: Party Chief, on behalf of N-Sea, during the retrofit continuity clamps installation project on the Belwind OWF. The Belwind OWF is located on Bligh Bank, 29 NM from the Belgian port of Zeebrugge. Each set of retrofit clamps includes a 73” and a 28” clamp. The 73” were installed horizontally on top of the jacket pile, where the 28” clamps were installed on the vertical diagonal member.

projects.title: Party Chief debris clearance survey North Eigg
projects.description: Party Chief, on behalf of N-Sea, during the debris clearance survey of North Eigg, sites Parkmead and Serica.

projects.title: Party Chief recovery bottom weights TNW & HKW
projects.description: Party Chief, on behalf of N-Sea, during the recovery of Metocean mooring remains on sites TNW (Ten Noorden van de Waddeneilanden) and HKW (Hollandse Kust West Offshore Wind Farm)

projects.title: Reports Coordinator Boulder and Debris Removal on Dogger Bank OWF
projects.description:
Reports Coordinator, on behalf of UXOcontrol, of boulder and debris removal campaign of the Dogger Bank Offshore Wind Farm owned by SSE Renewables and Equinor.

Dogger Bank Wind Farm is an offshore wind farm being developed in three phases – Dogger Bank A, B and C – located between 130km and 190km from the North East coast of England at their nearest points.

Collectively they will become the world’s largest offshore wind farm.

Each phase will have an installed generation capacity of up to 1.2GW and represents a multi-billion pound investment. Combined, they will have an installed capacity of up to 3.6GW and will be capable of powering up to 6 million homes.

projects.title: Party Chief UXO ID and clearance survey Shetland HVDC link
projects.description:
Party Chief, on behalf of N-Sea, during the UXO ID and clearance survey of Shetland HVDC link project. 

A 257km subsea cable will link Shetland to mainland Scotland, the submarine cable will use High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology to transmit power beneath the seabed between converter stations at Weisdale Voe on Shetland and Noss Head in Caithness. The cable bundle will consist of two conductor cables and one fibre optic communications cable, to allow control of the substation and HVDC converter station.

projects.title: Party Chief GNI pipeline survey, GVI and intervention campaign 2021
projects.description: Party Chief, on behalf of N-Sea for Gas Networks Ireland (GNI) pipeline inspection campaign 2021. Consisting out of survey, general visual inspection (GVI), close visual inspection (CVI) and intervention works as rock dumps and debris removal of the five GNI assets in the Irish sea.

projects.title: Party Chief Pre Lay Survey Shetland HVDC link
projects.description:
Party Chief, on behalf of N-Sea, during the pre lay survey of Shetland HVDC link project. 

A 257km subsea cable will link Shetland to mainland Scotland, the submarine cable will use High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) technology to transmit power beneath the seabed between converter stations at Weisdale Voe on Shetland and Noss Head in Caithness. The cable bundle will consist of two conductor cables and one fibre optic communications cable, to allow control of the substation and HVDC converter station.

projects.title: Party Chief UXO ID and clearance survey on Dogger Bank OWF
projects.description:
Party Chief, on behalf of UXOcontrol, of UXO identification and disposal campaign of the Dogger Bank Offshore Wind Farm owned by SSE Renewables and Equinor.

Dogger Bank Wind Farm is an offshore wind farm being developed in three phases – Dogger Bank A, B and C – located between 130km and 190km from the North East coast of England at their nearest points.

Collectively they will become the world’s largest offshore wind farm.

Each phase will have an installed generation capacity of up to 1.2GW and represents a multi-billion pound investment. Combined, they will have an installed capacity of up to 3.6GW and will be capable of powering up to 6 million homes.

projects.title: Party Chief UXO ID and clearance survey on Vattenfall - Hollandse Kust Zuid OWF
projects.description:
Party Chief, on behalf of UXOcontrol, of UXO identification and disposal campaign of the Hollandse Kust Zuid Offshore Windfarm. 

The site, divided in four parcels, is 18 kilometres off the coast, in the area between The Hague and Zandvoort. Hollandse Kust Zuid OWF is to be built without any government subsidy as the first subsidy-free wind farm in Europe. The government has decided that Hollandse Kust Zuid will be permitted to have a maximum of 252 wind turbines with a maximum height of 251 metres above sea level and a minimum capacity of 6MW.

projects.title: Report Coordinator UXO ID and clearance survey on Vattenfall - Hollandse Kust Zuid OWF
projects.description:
Report Coordinator, on behalf of UXOcontrol, of UXO identification and disposal campaign of the Hollandse Kust Zuid Offshore Windfarm. 

The site, divided in four parcels, is 18 kilometres off the coast, in the area between The Hague and Zandvoort. Hollandse Kust Zuid OWF is to be built without any government subsidy as the first subsidy-free wind farm in Europe. The government has decided that Hollandse Kust Zuid will be permitted to have a maximum of 252 wind turbines with a maximum height of 251 metres above sea level and a minimum capacity of 6MW.

projects.title: Report Coordinator UXO clearance survey on Cobra Wind - Kincardine Offshore Windfarm
projects.description: Report Coordinator (on behalf of UXOcontrol) of UXO clearance surveys of inter array cables of the Cobra Wind Kincardine Offshore Windfarm. A floating semi-submersible offshore wind farm, located in the North Sea, approximately 15 km to the south-east of Aberdeen from the Aberdeenshire coast.

projects.title: 3.4u Inspection Coordinator TenneT IRM Framework tender
projects.description: Preparing inspection, repair and maintenance tender for the TenneT IRM framework regarding 19 existing and planned fixed offshore steel structures in the southern North Sea.

projects.title: Project Engineer export cable CPS replacement campaign on TenneT - DolWin beta
projects.description: Project Engineer, on behalf of consortium SeaRenergy- N-Sea, for replacement of damaged cast iron cable protection system by SUB-FLEX vertebrae bend restrictor cable protection system of two high voltage direct current export cables and one fibre-optic cable from offshore substation DolWin beta, by means of diver and ROV intervention.

projects.title: Party Chief potential UXO survey on Vattenfall - DanTysk OWF
projects.description:
Party Chief, on behalf of UXOcontrol, of potential UXO survey campaign prior to repairs on seven inter-array cables and two wind turbine generators. 

DanTysk is a 288 MW offshore wind farm in the North Sea, The entire wind farm covers an area of 70 square kilometers and is located 70 km off the North Sea island of Sylt. Due to the curvature of the earth, the wind farm is not visible from the island. The wind farm comprises 80 wind turbines of 3.6 MW from Siemens. With a total output of 288 megawatts. The rotor diameter is 120 meters and the tip height reaches 148 meters. The foundations are monopiles, which were installed in water depths of 21 to 32 meters. The first foundation was installed in February 2014 and the wind farm produced its first kilowatt hour in December 2014.

A total of 88 power cables with a total length of 108 kilometres transport the power from each of the 80 wind turbines initially on the 33kV AC voltage level to the wind farm offshore substation.

projects.title: Party Chief UXO ID and clearance survey on Vattenfall - Hollandse Kust Zuid OWF
projects.description:
Party Chief, on behalf of UXOcontrol, of UXO identification and disposal campaign of the Hollandse Kust Zuid Offshore Windfarm. 

The site, divided in four parcels, is 18 kilometres off the coast, in the area between The Hague and Zandvoort. Hollandse Kust Zuid OWF is to be built without any government subsidy as the first subsidy-free wind farm in Europe. The government has decided that Hollandse Kust Zuid will be permitted to have a maximum of 252 wind turbines with a maximum height of 251 metres above sea level and a minimum capacity of 6MW.

projects.title: 3.4U Underwater Inspection Controller of BBL offshore pipeline survey campaign
projects.description:
3.4U Underwater Inspection Controller (on behalf of N-Sea) of the N.V. Nederlandse Gasunie / BBL Company offshore pipeline survey campaign 2020.

The BBL pipeline is a 235-kilometre gas pipeline with an hourly capacity of 20,600,000 kWh/h (Forward Flow) between Balgzand in the Netherlands and Bacton in the United Kingdom and an hourly capacity of 7,000,000 kWh/h (Reverse Flow) between Bacton and Balgzand, with gas flowing to and from the Netherlands to the United Kingdom.

projects.title: Supervisor / Report Coordinator during archaeological target identification campaign of Viking Link interconnector Denmark
projects.description:
Supervisor and Report Coordinator (on behalf of N-Sea) during archaeological target identification campaign of Viking Link interconnector Denmark.

Viking Link is a proposal to build a high voltage direct current (DC) electricity interconnector, 770km long, between Bicker Fen in Lincolnshire, Great Britain and the substation Revsing in southern Jutland, Denmark. The interconnector would enable more effective use of renewable energy, access to sustainable electricity generation and improved security of electricity supplies. Viking Link will include approximately 630 km of submarine high voltage direct current (DC) cables which will pass through the Exclusive Economic Zones (EEZs) of Denmark, the Netherlands, Germany and Great Britain in the North Sea. Approximately 220 km of this submarine high voltage DC cables will be installed within the British EEZ.

projects.title: Party Chief / Report Coordinator UXO clearance survey on Cobra Wind - Kincardine Offshore Windfarm
projects.description: Party Chief and Report Coordinator (on behalf of UXOcontrol) of UXO clearance surveys of export cable route, anchor mooring line paths and inter array cables of the Cobra Wind Kincardine Offshore Windfarm. A floating semi-submersible offshore wind farm, located in the North Sea, approximately 15 km to the south-east of Aberdeen from the Aberdeenshire coast.

projects.title: 3.4U Underwater Inspection Controller of decommissioning seabed surveys perenco UK
projects.description: 3.4U Underwater Inspection Controller (on behalf of N-Sea) of seabed clearance surveys, platform and pipeline inspections and environmental baseline survey prior to decommissioning activities in fields Amethyst, Pickerill and Wenlock of Perenco UK.

profile_positions.description: Self employed CSWIP 3.4u within the Oil & Gas industry, offshore renewable energy and experienced within the dive, survey and ROV industry and specialised in offshore windfarms, subsea inspection, repair and maintenance projects.
profile_positions.title: Self Employed
